title: MAG 123 - Web Development Transcript
text:
The Magnus Archives – 123 - Web Development 
1 
 
MAG – 123 – Web Development 
Content Warnings: 
- Body horror 
- Spiders 
- Insect infestation 
- Direct violence 
- Extreme aggression 
- Emotional trauma 
- Grief 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill presents The Magnus Archives. Episode one hundred and twenty-
three. Web Development. 
[Tape clicks on.] 
(The Archivist is sighing and mumbling to himself, searching his office) 
ARCHIVIST 
Right, where did the— “A coma? Great! Let’s rearrange his office! Sleeping 
people don’t need pens.” 
[Brief sound of something squelching.] 
Urgh. Urgh, what…? 

The Magnus Archives – 123 - Web Development 
2 
 
[Sounds of movement outside. Door opens] 
[The Archivist & Melanie’s subsequent conversation takes place in the 
corridor and is somewhat distant to the recorder] 
ARCHIVIST 
Melanie! It’d be good to, uh… Melanie? Are you al— 
[Something ceramic crashes and smashes] 
Woah! Woah! 
MELANIE 
(Snarling) Get away from me! 
ARCHIVIST 
Melanie, it’s, it’s me. 
MELANIE 
No, no, no. 
ARCHIVIST 
Look. No, I-I-I-I-I’m back. 
MELANIE 
Oh, oh, yeah? Back to your happy little family! 
ARCHIVIST 
What? No, I, I didn’t mean— 

The Magnus Archives – 123 - Web Development 
3 
 
MELANIE 
How’d you make it out, then, hm? 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
MELANIE 
Tim is dead! Daisy is dead! And you? What, you’re just fine?! 
ARCHIVIST 
Wha— No, I’ve been in hospital for six months! 
MELANIE 
Something has been in hospital. Something that’s got your face. I, I warned 
Basira! I said not to let you back in here, but she just doesn’t listen! 
ARCHIVIST 
(Calming) Melanie, Melanie… it’s me. 
MELANIE 
Oh, okay. So what? Hi John, how are you? Get anyone killed lately? 
ARCHIVIST 
I… I… 
MELANIE 

The Magnus Archives – 123 - Web Development 
4 
 
(Aggrieved) Wipe that look off your face. Like you’re not the reason all of this 
is happening. Like you’re any better than, than him. 
ARCHIVIST 
(The Archivist burbles for a few moments) But Basira said Elias was gone. 
MELANIE 
Oh, gone? Right, yes, yes. He’s… he’s ‘gone’. Like that makes any difference. 
ARCHIVIST 
I don’t understand. 
MELANIE 
No, you don’t, do you? He’s still alive. You are still alive! So this place is still… 
(Inarticulate sounds of Melanie’s rage) 
ARCHIVIST 
Melanie! Melanie, this isn’t you. 
MELANIE 
(Snarled) Back! Off! 
[Fist connects solidly] 
You don’t know me! And I don’t know you. So stay the hell away from me or I 
swear I’ll— 
ARCHIVIST 

The Magnus Archives – 123 - Web Development 
5 
 
Okay… okay. 
[Melanie leaves] 
I-I’m sorry. 
[Tape clicks off. Tape clicks on] 
ARCHIVIST 
She nearly attacked me, Basira! I mean, I know me and Melanie haven’t always 
seen eye to eye before, but… Christ! 
BASIRA 
Yeah, I did warn you. She’s not, uh, she’s not been having a good time. 
ARCHIVIST 
Mmm! Yes, I did get that impression. 
(Sighs) Elias is gone. I thought— I mean, wasn’t that supposed to be… it? But 
she is still— 
BASIRA 
It’s not that simple. 
ARCHIVIST 
She needs help, Basira. God, it didn’t even get that bad with… Even Tim never 
threatened me, not like that. 
BASIRA 

The Magnus Archives – 123 - Web Development 
6 
 
Right, just back off. You haven’t been here. 
ARCHIVIST 
O-okay. You’re right. I haven’t, so explain it to me. 
BASIRA 
(Long sigh) Alright. Best I can understand it, Beholding or The Eye or whatever 
you want to call it, we’re one of the only powers that hasn’t actually taken a 
shot at a ritual. Yet. And everything out there knows it. 
ARCHIVIST 
No, I mean, we… we can’t be the only ones, surely? 
BASIRA 
I don’t know. Probably not. 
But we made a big noise with the Unknowing, and… other stuff… and now 
they’ve taken notice. We’re safe in here. Usually. But we don’t go out much 
anymore. 
ARCHIVIST 
“Usually”? 
BASIRA 
Yeah. 
ARCHIVIST 
You were attacked. When? 

The Magnus Archives – 123 - Web Development 
7 
 
BASIRA 
About two months ago. It was, uh… It was The Flesh. 
ARCHIVIST 
Oh God. 
BASIRA 
Yeah. It was bad. We took them all out. Melanie did most of them. She was… 
She got a knife from somewhere and— 
ARCHIVIST 
Basira, I… I don’t know if that’s a good sign. 
BASIRA 
She saved my life, John. She saved all of us. I won’t forget that. 
ARCHIVIST 
Fine. Fine. 
Haven’t seen Martin about yet? 
BASIRA 
Yeah, he comes and goes. He’s busy. Well, he seems it. 
ARCHIVIST 
Working for Peter Lukas. 
BASIRA
